subject: Hockey, Ice
lead_paragraph: Another potential buyer has surfaced for the Phoenix Coyotes, one who would keep the team in Glendale, Ariz. An attorney for the Las Vegas-based businessman John Breslow, who owns 3 percent of the Coyotes, said Breslow told the N.H.L. he has formed a group interested in submitting a bid for the team. Jerry Moyes, the Coyotes’ owner, filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection for the team earlier this month. The only bid so far for the team is a $212.5 million offer from Jim Balsillie, a Canadian. The bid is contingent on moving the team to Hamilton, Ontario.
